verse.roman:
pauravī rohiṇī bhadrā
madirā rocanā ilā
devakī-pramukhāś cāsan
patnya ānakadundubheḥ

synonyms: pauravī—Pauravī; rohiṇī—Rohiṇī; bhadrā—Bhadrā; madirā—Madirā; rocanā—Rocanā; ilā—Ilā; devakī—Devakī; pramukhāḥ—headed by; ca—and; āsan—existed; patnyaḥ—wives; ānakadundubheḥ—of Vasudeva, who was known as Ānakadundubhi.
translation: Devakī, Pauravī, Rohiṇī, Bhadrā, Madirā, Rocanā, Ilā and others were all wives of Ānakadundubhi [Vasudeva]. Among them all, Devakī was the chief.
